incorrect sentence: It’s really better.
correct sentence: It’s much better.

incorrect sentence: I’d like to visit more countries as possible.
correct sentence: I’d like to visit as many countries as possible.

incorrect sentence: You need to do your better.
correct sentence: You need to do your best.

incorrect sentence: If you’re more close to the person, you have to give a bigger gift.
correct sentence: If you’re closer to the person, you have to give a bigger gift.

incorrect sentence: It’s more easy to dance in high heels than to walk.
correct sentence: It’s easier to dance in high heels than to walk.

incorrect sentence: It’s really easier for us.
correct sentence: It’s much / a lot easier for us.

incorrect sentence: It’s more easy to buy euros now.
correct sentence: It’s easier to buy euros now.

incorrect sentence: Here it’s more safe than in Brazil.
correct sentence: Here it’s safer than in Brazil. / It’s safer here than in Brazil.

incorrect sentence: He didn’t spend a lot of money like her.
correct sentence: He didn’t spend as much money as her.

incorrect sentence: Testing on animals is more better than testing on humans.
correct sentence: Testing on animals is better than testing on humans.

incorrect sentence: If you’re the first-born child, you’re the older.
correct sentence: If you’re the first-born child, you’re the oldest.

incorrect sentence: It’s so cheaper.
correct sentence: It’s (so) much cheaper.

incorrect sentence: Back then it wasn’t too expensive like now.
correct sentence: Back then it wasn’t as expensive as (it is) now.

incorrect sentence: It’s not that much dangerous as Brazil.
correct sentence: It’s not as dangerous as Brazil.

incorrect sentence: It’s more expensive, but it’s more easy.
correct sentence: It’s more expensive, but it’s easier.

incorrect sentence: Is it more cold than Ireland?
correct sentence: Is it colder than Ireland?

incorrect sentence: In Brazil they’re not so conscious of the environment like here.
correct sentence: In Brazil they’re not as conscious of the environment as here.

incorrect sentence: It’s more healthier than meat.
correct sentence: It’s healthier than meat.

incorrect sentence: Most of people didn’t pay.
correct sentence: Most people didn’t pay. / Most of the people didn’t pay.

incorrect sentence: Blockbuster used to be the bigger company.
correct sentence: Blockbuster used to be the biggest company.

incorrect sentence: To learn a language, you have to start very younger.
correct sentence:
To learn a language, you have to start much younger.
To learn a language, you have to start very young.

incorrect sentence: You’ll get there more fast with help.
correct sentence: You’ll get there faster with help.

incorrect sentence: I’d like to be more close to my father.
correct sentence: I’d like to be closer to my father.

incorrect sentence: I lived in a neighbourhood more safe.
correct sentence: I lived in a safer neighbourhood.

incorrect sentence: It’s so faster.
correct sentence: It’s (so) much faster.

incorrect sentence: Sometimes I’m more slowly.
correct sentence: Sometimes I’m slower. / Sometimes I go more slowly.

incorrect sentence: It’s more deeper.
correct sentence: It’s deeper.

incorrect sentence: It’s more practical and more safe.
correct sentence:
It’s more practical and safer.
It’s safer and more practical.

incorrect sentence: The more important is understanding people.
correct sentence: The most important thing is understanding people.

incorrect sentence: It’s very more expensive.
correct sentence: It’s much/a lot more expensive.

incorrect sentence: When I was a child, I was more good at sports.
correct sentence: When I was a child, I was better at sports.

incorrect sentence: The taste is more strong.
correct sentence: The taste is stronger.

incorrect sentence: River fish are the best than fish from the ocean.
correct sentence: River fish are better than fish from the ocean.

incorrect sentence: When I’m more happy, I listen to Brazilian funk.
correct sentence: When I’m happier, I listen to Brazilian funk.

incorrect sentence: It’s more hard.
correct sentence: It’s harder.

incorrect sentence: Ireland is more safe than Brazil.
correct sentence: Ireland is safer than Brazil.

incorrect sentence: It’s so safe than Ireland.
correct sentence: It’s (so) much safer than Ireland.

incorrect sentence: If I moved to another country, I would be more healthy.
correct sentence: If I moved to another country, I would be healthier.

incorrect sentence: It will get more easier.
correct sentence: It will get easier.

incorrect sentence: She’s the person in my family that I’m more close to.
correct sentence: She’s the person in my family that I’m closest to.

incorrect sentence: Sao Paulo has the most big exhibitions.
correct sentence: Sao Paulo has the biggest exhibitions.

incorrect sentence: It’s the most fast means of transport.
correct sentence: It’s the fastest means of transport.
